CVE-2024-49138 (7.8 high) Microsoft Windows Common Log File System (CLFS) Driver Heap-Based Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

This additional information was not disclosed in Microsoft's security advisory (see parent toot above).

screaminggoat at 2024-12-10T17:58:30.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: 71 new vulnerabilities, ONE ZERO-DAY:

  • CVE-2024-49138 (7.8 high) Windows Common Log File System Driver Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED, EXPLOITED)

Update for CVE-2024-38033 (7.3 high, from 09 July 2024) PowerShell Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability was reissued a patch for all affected versions of Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2.

The Microsoft data arrived almost 10 minutes early.

##

CVE-2024-45337
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T21:15:08.500000

1 posts

Applications and libraries which misuse the ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback callback may be susceptible to an authorization bypass. The documentation for ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback says that "A call to this function does not guarantee that the key offered is in fact used to authenticate." Specifically, the SSH protocol allows clients to inquire about whether a public key is acceptable before pr

astrakernel.bsky.social@bsky.brid.gy at 2024-12-12T05:34:22.465Z ##

ð¦« CVE-2024-45337: Vulnerability in Go standard library -x/crypto/ssh: Applications and libraries which misuse the ServerConfig.PublicKeyCallback callback may be susceptible to an authorization bypass github.com/golang/go/is... #programming #golang

##

CVE-2024-53677(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T19:35:14

4 posts

File upload logic is flawed vulnerability in Apache Struts. This issue affects Apache Struts: from 2.0.0 before 6.4.0. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 6.4.0, which fixes the issue. You can find more details inÂ  https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-067

1 repos

https://github.com/cloudwafs/s2-067-CVE-2024-53677

screaminggoat at 2024-12-11T21:07:17.228Z ##

Apache Struts security advisory 26? November 2024: S2-067
CVE-2024-53677 (CVSSv4: 9.5 critical) File upload logic is flawed, and allows an attacker to enable paths with traversals (@cR0w @reverseics) (impact: remote code execution)
For those of you keeping track, Apache Struts has eight CVEs in CISA's KEV Catalog, 7 of which are related to remote code execution. One is known to be used in ransomware campaigns ðº

#apache #struts #CVE_2024_53677 #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-11T19:09:46.000Z ##

Critical ../ -> RCE in Apache Struts? Nice. The bulletin is from a couple weeks ago but the CVE was just published today: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-067

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-53677

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-12-12T19:56:05.572Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) cloud vulnerability advisories:

  • CVE-2024-49071 (6.5 medium) Windows Defender Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49147 (9.3 critical) Microsoft Update Catalog Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely/N/A. 49147 is interesting: "Deserialization of untrusted data in Microsoft Update Catalog allows an unauthorized attacker to elevate privileges on the websiteâs webserver."

EPSS: 0.04%

4 posts

screaminggoat at 2024-12-13T03:10:17.147Z ##

@browserversiontracker https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security#december-12-2024

December 12, 2024
Microsoft has released the latest Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 131.0.2903.99) that incorporates the latest updates of the Chromium project.

  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-12381
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-12382

cc: @ruario

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-10T23:02:33.458Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Google Chrome: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
New Chromium version 131.0.6778.139/.140 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.139 for Linux includes 3 security fixes, 2 externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-12381 (high) Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-12382 (high) Use after free in Translate

No mention of exploitation. cc: @ruario

#chrome #google #cybersecurity #vulnerability #CVE #infosec

CVE-2024-54492
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T16:15:56.273000

4 posts

This issue was addressed by using HTTPS when sending information over the network. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.2, iOS 18.2 and iPadOS 18.2, iPadOS 17.7.3, visionOS 2.2. An attacker in a privileged network position may be able to alter network traffic.

mysk@mastodon.social at 2024-12-12T23:41:44.000Z ##

The severity level of this bug is critical, 9.8 out of 10. Upgrade your devices.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln-metrics/cvss/v3-calculator?name=CVE-2024-54492&vector=AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H&version=3.1&source=CISA-ADP

#iOS #iPhone #security #infosec #Apple #cybersecurity

The bug also impacts iPadOS and #macOS

CVE-2024-42448
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T15:15:14.230000

2 posts

From the VSPC management agent machine, under condition that the management agent is authorized on the server, it is possible to perform Remote Code Execution (RCE) on the VSPC server machine.

2 repos

https://github.com/zetraxz/CVE-2024-42448

https://github.com/h3lye/CVE-2024-42448-RCE

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T15:28:54.180Z ##

Veeam security advisory 03 December 2024: Veeam Service Provider Console Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42448 | CVE-2024-42449)

  • CVE-2024-42448 (9.9 critical) remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-42449 (7.1 high) NTLM hash leak of the VSPC service account and file deletion

No mention of exploitation. This is not Veeeam backup and replication (see parent toot above)

#veeam #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T15:28:54.000Z ##

Veeam security advisory 03 December 2024: Veeam Service Provider Console Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-42448 | CVE-2024-42449)

  • CVE-2024-42448 (9.9 critical) remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-42449 (7.1 high) NTLM hash leak of the VSPC service account and file deletion

No mention of exploitation. This is not Veeeam backup and replication (see parent toot above)

##

CVE-2024-21575
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T15:15:12.733000

2 posts

ComfyUI-Impact-Pack is vulnerable to Path Traversal. The issue stems from missing validation of the `image.filename` field in a POST request sent to the `/upload/temp` endpoint added by the extension to the server. This results in writing arbitrary files to the file system which may, under some conditions, result in remote code execution (RCE).

1 repos

#search_error

cR0w at 2024-12-12T15:56:22.335Z ##

@ciaranmak @screaminggoat @FritzAdalis Okay, this is funny. We also have a critical ../ in ComfyUI: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21575

##

CVE-2024-8647
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T12:31:22

2 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab affecting all versions starting 15.2 to 17.4.6, 17.5 prior to 17.5.4, and 17.6 prior to 17.6.2. On self hosted installs, it was possible to leak the anti-CSRF-token to an external site while the Harbor integration was enabled.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-11T16:30:38.865Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday on a Wednesday from GitLab: GitLab Patch Release: 17.6.2, 17.5.4, 17.4.6

  • CVE-2024-11274 (8.7 high) Injection of Network Error Logging (NEL) headers in kubernetes proxy response could lead to account takeover abusing OAuth flows
  • CVE-2024-8233 (7.5 high) Denial of Service by repeatedly sending unauthenticated requests for diff-files
  • No CVE ID (6.7 medium) CI_JOB_TOKEN could be used to obtain GitLab session
  • CVE-2024-9387 (6.4 medium) Open redirect in releases API
  • CVE-2024-8647 (5.4 medium) Client-Side Path Traversal in Harbor artifact links
  • CVE-2024-8179 (5.4 medium) HTML injection in vulnerability details could lead to Cross Site Scripting
  • CVE-2024-8116 (5.3 medium) Leak branch names of projects with confidential repository
  • CVE-2024-8650 (5.3 medium) Non member can view unresolved threads marked as internal notes
  • CVE-2024-9367 (4.3 medium) Uncontrolled Resource Consumption through a maliciously crafted file
  • CVE-2024-12292 (4.0 medium) Certain sensitive information passed as literals inside GraphQL mutations retained in GraphQL logs
  • CVE-2024-10043 (3.1 low) Information disclosure of confidential incidents details to a group member in Gitlab Wiki
  • CVE-2024-9633 (3.1 low) Domain Confusion in GitLab Pages Unique Domain Implementation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-11T16:30:38.000Z ##

CVE-2024-9367
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T12:31:22

2 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 13.9 before 17.4.6, 17.5 before 17.5.4, and 17.6 before 17.6.2, that allows an attacker to cause uncontrolled CPU consumption, potentially leading to a Denial of Service (DoS) condition while parsing templates to generate changelogs.

  • CVE-2024-11274 (8.7 high) Injection of Network Error Logging (NEL) headers in kubernetes proxy response could lead to account takeover abusing OAuth flows
  • CVE-2024-8233 (7.5 high) Denial of Service by repeatedly sending unauthenticated requests for diff-files
  • No CVE ID (6.7 medium) CI_JOB_TOKEN could be used to obtain GitLab session
  • CVE-2024-9387 (6.4 medium) Open redirect in releases API
  • CVE-2024-8647 (5.4 medium) Client-Side Path Traversal in Harbor artifact links
  • CVE-2024-8179 (5.4 medium) HTML injection in vulnerability details could lead to Cross Site Scripting
  • CVE-2024-8116 (5.3 medium) Leak branch names of projects with confidential repository
  • CVE-2024-8650 (5.3 medium) Non member can view unresolved threads marked as internal notes
  • CVE-2024-9367 (4.3 medium) Uncontrolled Resource Consumption through a maliciously crafted file
  • CVE-2024-12292 (4.0 medium) Certain sensitive information passed as literals inside GraphQL mutations retained in GraphQL logs
  • CVE-2024-10043 (3.1 low) Information disclosure of confidential incidents details to a group member in Gitlab Wiki
  • CVE-2024-9633 (3.1 low) Domain Confusion in GitLab Pages Unique Domain Implementation

No mention of exploitation.

#gitlab #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-21574
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T09:15:06.037000

4 posts

The issue stems from a missing validation of the pip field in a POST request sent to the /customnode/install endpoint used to install custom nodes which is added to the server by the extension. This allows an attacker to craft a request that triggers a pip install on a user controlled package or URL, resulting in remote code execution (RCE) on the server.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-12T13:32:40.902Z ##

@cR0w I agree with @FritzAdalis, it looks like cvefeed.io dun goofed and wrote CVE-2024-21574 as Apache Solr when the vendor is ltdrdata and product ComfyUI-Manager.

I don't go off assumptions so I will rely on the public record of ComfyUI-Manager (which I've never heard of).

##
cR0w at 2024-12-12T13:19:14.840Z ##

Another hit for Apache. This time it's a perfect 10 ( ð» @screaminggoat ) in Solr: https://cvefeed.io/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-21574

Note: Apache Solr does not list the CVE on their site ( yet? ) and I have not confirmed that this Comfy-UI-Manager vuln does indeed impact Solr. I'm relying on CVE Feed for this one. But it's a 10 so it's worth putting out there to look into.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-12T13:32:40.000Z ##

updated 2024-12-12T06:31:02

1 posts

The Vayu Blocks â Gutenberg Blocks for WordPress & WooCommerce plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized arbitrary plugin installation and activation due to a missing capability check on the tp_install() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.1.1. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to install and activate arbitrary plugins which can be leveraged to achieve remo

CVE-2024-49122
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-12T02:04:38.950000

4 posts

Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-11053
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-11T15:15:07.783000

14 posts

When asked to both use a `.netrc` file for credentials and to follow HTTP redirects, curl could leak the password used for the first host to the followed-to host under certain circumstances. This flaw only manifests itself if the netrc file has an entry that matches the redirect target hostname but the entry either omits just the password or omits both login and password.

1 repos

#search_error

RedPacketSecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-12-12T15:30:01.000Z ##

CVE Alert: CVE-2024-11053 - https://www.redpacketsecurity.com/cve_alert_cve-2024-11053/

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_11053

##
harrysintonen at 2024-12-11T07:12:24.524Z ##

#curl 8.11.1 has been released. It includes a fix to #CVE_2024_11053 - a #vulnerability I discovered.

It is a logic flaw in the way curl parses .netrc file. In certain situations, the configured password can be sent to a incorrect host. Luckily the affected configurations should be quite rare and thus the situation is unlikely to occur often.

The issue has existed in the curl source code for almost twenty-five years.

â¢ https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-11053.html
â¢ https://hackerone.com/reports/2829063

No AI tools were used in discovering or reporting the vulnerability.

#noai #handcrafted #infosec #cybersecurity

#OSINT #ThreatIntel #CyberSecurity #cve_2024_11053

##
osnews@mstdn.social at 2024-12-12T14:02:22.000Z ##

A twenty-five year old curl bug

When we announced the security flaw CVE-2024-11053 on December 11, 2024 together with the release of curl 8.11.1 we fixed a security bug that was introduced in a curl release 9039 days ago. That is close to twenty-five years.

The previous record holder was CVE-2022-35252 at 8729 days.
â« Daniel Stenberg

Ir's really quite fascinating to see details like this

https://www.osnews.com/story/141320/a-twenty-five-year-old-curl-bug/

#GeneralDevelopment

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-12-11T13:39:46.000Z ##

CVE-2024-11053 holds the new #curl record with its ** 9039 ** days present in code until fixed

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-12-11T07:20:56.000Z ##

The new #curl CVE-2024-11053 we call "netrc and redirect credential leak"

While graded severity low, it will of course still be relevant to whomever uses the unlucky combination of options.

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-11053.html

##
osnews@mstdn.social at 2024-12-12T14:02:22.000Z ##

The previous record holder was CVE-2022-35252 at 8729 days.
â« Daniel Stenberg

CVE-2024-12344
(6.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-11T00:32:28

2 posts

A vulnerability, which was classified as critical, was found in TP-Link VN020 F3v(T) TT_V6.2.1021. This affects an unknown part of the component FTP USER Command Handler. The manipulation leads to memory corruption. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-50623
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-10T21:31:55

42 posts

In Cleo Harmony before 5.8.0.20, VLTrader before 5.8.0.20, and LexiCom before 5.8.0.20, there is a JavaScript Injection vulnerability.

1 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/CVE-2024-50623

screaminggoat at 2024-12-13T03:19:29.284Z ##

Cleo security advisory: Patch Version 5.8.0.24 Made Available to Address Previously Reported Critical Vulnerability (CVE Pending)
The newest patch which (supposedly) fixes the CVE-2024-50623 patch bypass was technically available yesterday 10 December 2024. This product security update announcement was the next day, 11 December 2024. The CVE is still pending, who the F is the CNA?? This zero-day vulnerability needs a CVE in order to properly track it.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_50623 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #cleo #harmony #vltrader #lexicom #ActiveExploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #IOC #zeroday

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-12T02:05:38.155Z ##

CCCS (Canada): Alert - Vulnerability impacting all versions of Cleo VLTrader, Harmony, and LexiCom software
This is one of the first government security advisories confirming the active exploitation of Cleo VLTrader, Harmony, and LexiCom software, that current versions are still exploitable, and that there's an as-yet-unassigned vulnerability paired with CVE-2024-50623 (8.8 high) Cleo Harmony/VLTrader/LexiCom remote code execution. Their suggested actions are linked in the references at the bottom.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_50623 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #cleo #harmony #vltrader #lexicom #ActiveExploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #IOC #zeroday

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-11T19:26:23.508Z ##

Rapid7: Modular Java Backdoor Dropped in Cleo Exploitation Campaign
Rapid7 reports a Java-based Remote Access Trojan (RAT) being dropped in the mass exploitation of Cleo software (Harmony, VLTrader, LexiCom). They provide a malware analysis, as well as observed post-exploitation activity. Indicators of compromise provided, and TTPs mapped to MITRE ATT&CK.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_50623 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #cleo #harmony #vltrader #lexicom #ActiveExploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #IOC #zeroday

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-11T16:35:20.050Z ##

watchTowr: Cleo Harmony, VLTrader, and LexiCom - RCE via Arbitrary File Write (CVE-2024-50623)
With Cleo software under active exploitation by threat actors (and rumors of Termite ransomware group being in possession of the zero-day exploit), watchTowr patch diffs and explores CVE-2024-50623 (8.8 high) Cleo Harmony/VLTrader/LexiCom remote code execution. This isn't much that isn't already covered by Huntress (which includes Indicators of Compromise).

There's the possibility that the "CVE Pending" will be labeled a CVE-2024-50623 patch bypass vulnerability due to the insufficient patch.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_50623 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #cleo #harmony #vltrader #lexicom #Activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity #IOC #zeroday

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-10T05:04:02.236Z ##

Huntress: Threat Advisory: Oh No Cleo! Cleo Software Actively Being Exploited in the Wild
Full writeup of the Cleo software exploitation, from observed tradecraft to verifying that the original patch wasn't sufficient. Huntress provides recommendations ("We strongly recommend you move any internet-exposed Cleo systems behind a firewall until a new patch is released.") and offer Sigma Rules and Indicators of Compromise.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_50623 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #cleo #harmony #Activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-10T03:57:58.699Z ##

Huntress Labs on Reddit: INCIDENT: Threat Actors Currently Mass-Exploiting Cleo Servers (0-day-ish)
TL;DR - Cleo software CVE-2024-50623 is being actively exploited in-the-wild and fully patched systems running 5.8.0.21 are still exploitable. We strongly recommend you immediately move any affected, internet-exposed Cleo systems behind a firewall until a new patch is released. Afterwards, review your logs for signs of intrusion.

Although Cleo published an update and advisory on October 29, 2024 for CVE-2024-50623âwhich allows unauthenticated remote code executionâHuntress security researchers have recreated the proof-of-concept and learned the patch does not mitigate the vulnerability.

#CVE_2024_50623 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #cleo #harmony #Activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-10T05:04:02.000Z ##

Huntress: Threat Advisory: Oh No Cleo! Cleo Software Actively Being Exploited in the Wild
Full writeup of the Cleo software exploitation, from observed tradecraft to verifying that the original patch wasn't sufficient. Huntress provides recommendations ("We strongly recommend you move any internet-exposed Cleo systems behind a firewall until a new patch is released.") and offer Sigma Rules and Indicators of Compromise.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_50623 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #cleo #harmony #Activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-10T03:57:58.000Z ##

Huntress Labs on Reddit: INCIDENT: Threat Actors Currently Mass-Exploiting Cleo Servers (0-day-ish)
TL;DR - Cleo software CVE-2024-50623 is being actively exploited in-the-wild and fully patched systems running 5.8.0.21 are still exploitable. We strongly recommend you immediately move any affected, internet-exposed Cleo systems behind a firewall until a new patch is released. Afterwards, review your logs for signs of intrusion.

Although Cleo published an update and advisory on October 29, 2024 for CVE-2024-50623âwhich allows unauthenticated remote code executionâHuntress security researchers have recreated the proof-of-concept and learned the patch does not mitigate the vulnerability.

#CVE_2024_50623 #vulnerability #cve #eitw #cleo #harmony #Activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
tychotithonus at 2024-12-10T19:32:05.342Z ##

Re CVE-2024-11633 ("Argument injection in Ivanti Connect Secure before version 22.7R2.4") ...

it "allows a remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to achieve remote code execution"

(emphasis mine)

... should this warrant a 9.1 (Critical) ?

I mean, I guess if someone steals the creds for your admin user and then uses it to implant something under the hood, that would be bad, so ... maybe so.

  • Ivanti Desktop and Server Management (DSM)

updated 2024-12-10T19:15:19.690000

Ivanti Issues Critical Security Updates for CSA and Connect Secure Vulnerabilities. jbhall56 at 2024-12-11T14:21:46.463Z ##

The security flaw (tracked as CVE-2024-11639 and reported by CrowdStrike's Advanced Research Team) enables remote attackers to gain administrative privileges on vulnerable appliances running Ivanti CSA 5.0.2 or earlier. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ivanti-warns-of-maximum-severity-csa-auth-bypass-vulnerability/

updated 2024-12-10T18:31:13

4 posts

cR0w at 2024-12-10T18:52:02.106Z ##

@screaminggoat CVE-2024-53247 is because of an insecure usage of the jsonpickle library. Someone needs to create an exploit and name it PickleMilker.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-10T18:17:20.792Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Splunk:

  • SVD-2024-1201 Information Disclosure in Mobile Alert Responses in Splunk Secure Gateway (CVE-2024-53243, 4.3 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1202 Risky command safeguards bypass in "/en-US/app/search/report" endpoint through "s" parameter (CVE-2024-53244, 5.7 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1203 Information Disclosure due to Username Collision with a Role that has the same Name as the User (CVE-2024-53245, 3.1 low)
  • SVD-2024-1204 Sensitive Information Disclosure through SPL commands (CVE-2024-53246, 5.3 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1205 Remote Code Execution through Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Splunk Secure Gateway app (CVE-2024-53247, 8.8 high)
  • SVD-2024-1206 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - December 2024 (multiple CVEs)
  • SVD-2024-1207 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Universal Forwarder - December 2024 (CVE-2024-5535, 9.1 critical)

No verbiage of exploitation.

#splunk #infosec #cybersecurity #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-53246
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-10T18:31:13

2 posts

In Splunk Enterprise versions below 9.3.2, 9.2.4, and 9.1.7 and Splunk Cloud Platform versions below 9.3.2408.101, 9.2.2406.106, 9.2.2403.111, and 9.1.2312.206, an SPL command can potentially disclose sensitive information. CVE-2024-53919
(7.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-10T18:31:07

2 posts

An injection vulnerability in Barco ClickShare CX-30/20, C-5/10, and ClickShare Bar Pro and Core models, running firmware before 2.21.1, allows physically proximate attackers or local admins to the webUI to trigger OS-level command execution as root.

CVE-2024-46907
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-10T18:23:41.573000

2 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2024.0.1, a SQL Injection vulnerability allows an authenticated low-privileged user (at least Report Viewer permissions required) to achieve privilege escalation to the admin account.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.854Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletinâ September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

#progress #whatsupgold #wug #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_8785 #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-11205
(8.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-10T05:15:05.510000

8 posts

The WPForms plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the 'wpforms_is_admin_page' function in versions starting from 1.8.4 up to, and including, 1.9.2.1. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to refund payments and cancel subscriptions.

CVE-2024-41713
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-12-09T15:15:14.493000

8 posts

A vulnerability in the NuPoint Unified Messaging (NPM) component of Mitel MiCollab through 9.8 SP1 FP2 (9.8.1.201) could allow an unauthenticated attacker to conduct a path traversal attack, due to insufficient input validation. A successful exploit could allow unauthorized access, enabling the attacker to view, corrupt, or delete users' data and system configurations.

Nuclei template

1 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/Mitel-MiCollab-Auth-Bypass_CVE-2024-41713

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-05T16:34:16.704Z ##

watchTowr: Where There's Smoke, There's Fire - Mitel MiCollab CVE-2024-35286, CVE-2024-41713 And An 0day
Mitel MiCollab is an application for voice, video, messaging, presence, audio conferencing, mobility and team collaboration. watchTowr publishes vulnerability details for CVE-2024-35286 (SQL Injection), and CVE-2024-41713 (authentication bypass). Additionally they publicly disclose a post-authenticated arbitrary file read vulnerability (unpatched) that Mitel failed to patch within 100 days of reporting. This includes proof of concept.

#mitel #micollab #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #proofofconcept #poc #voip

##

##

CVE-2024-46901
(3.1 LOW)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-09T10:15:05.230000

1 posts

Insufficient validation of filenames against control characters in Apache Subversion repositories served via mod_dav_svn allows authenticated users with commit access to commit a corrupted revision, leading to disruption for users of the repository. All versions of Subversion up to and including Subversion 1.14.4 are affected if serving repositories via mod_dav_svn. Users are recommended to upgra

1 repos

#search_error

marreg@digitalcourage.social at 2024-12-09T12:37:55.000Z ##

c.p.

I'm happy to announce the release of Apache Subversion 1.14.5.

This is a stable bugfix and security release of the Apache Subversion
open source version control system.

Among regular bug fixes, this release fixes CVE-2024-46901:

mod_dav_svn denial-of-service via control characters in paths

It has been discovered that the patch for CVE-2013-1968 was incomplete
and unintentionally left mod_dav_svn vulnerable to control characters
in filenames.

If a path or a revision-property which contains control characters is
committed to a repository then SVN operations served by mod_dav_svn
can be disrupted.

Reported by:
HaoZi, WordPress China

https://subversion.apache.org/security/CVE-2024-46901-advisory.txt

updated 2024-12-08T12:30:46

The manipulation of the argument NewConnectionType leads to buffer overflow. The attack needs to be done within the local network. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

updated 2024-12-08T09:30:33

This issue affects some unknown processing of the file /control/WANIPConnection of the component Incomplete SOAP Request Handler. The manipulation leads to denial of service. The attack can only be initiated within the local network. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used.

CVE-2024-12026
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-07T03:30:47

4 posts

The Message Filter for Contact Form 7 plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the saveFilter() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.3. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to create new filters.

CVE-2024-46906
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T21:51:59.830000

2 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2024.0.1, a SQL Injection vulnerability allows an authenticated low-privileged user (at least Report Viewer permissions required) to achieve privilege escalation to the admin account.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.854Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletinâ September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

#progress #whatsupgold #wug #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_8785 #infosec #cybersecurity

  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection

  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T21:30:51

2 posts

NVIDIA UFM Enterprise, UFM Appliance, and UFM CyberAI contain a vulnerability where an attacker can cause an improper authentication issue by sending a malformed request through the Ethernet management interface. A successful exploit of this vulnerability might lead to escalation of privileges, data tampering, denial of service, and information disclosure.

CVE-2024-45204
(7.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T20:15:26.653000

2 posts

A vulnerability exists where a low-privileged user can exploit insufficient permissions in credential handling to leak NTLM hashes of saved credentials. The exploitation involves using retrieved credentials to expose sensitive NTLM hashes, impacting systems beyond the initial target and potentially leading to broader security vulnerabilities.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.270Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Vulnerabilities Resolved in Veeam Backup & Replication 12.3

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts
  • CVE-2024-42455 (7.1 high) authenticated arbitrary file deletion by sending a serialized temporary file collection
  • CVE-2024-42456 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42457 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (expose saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

No mention of exploitation but it's 2024 and Veeam still has NTLM hash vulnerabilities.

CVE-2024-11680
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.26%

updated 2024-12-06T18:42:17.390000

14 posts

ProjectSend versions prior to r1720 are affected by an improper authentication vulnerability. Remote, unauthenticated attackers can exploit this flaw by sending crafted HTTP requests to options.php, enabling unauthorized modification of the application's configuration. Successful exploitation allows attackers to create accounts, upload webshells, and embed malicious JavaScript.

1 repos

DarkWebInformer at 2024-12-04T19:18:46.094Z ##

ð¨Proof of Concept (PoC) Exploit for CVE-2024-11680, Critical Vulnerability in ProjectSend

https://darkwebinformer.com/proof-of-concept-poc-exploit-for-cve-2024-11680-critical-vulnerability-in-projectsend/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked ðº "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-12-03T16:01:06.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-11680
Vendor: ProjectSend
Product: ProjectSend
Date Added: 2024-12-03
Vulnerability: ProjectSend Improper Authentication Vulnerability
Notes: https://github.com/projectsend/projectsend/commit/193367d937b1a59ed5b68dd4e60bd53317473744 ; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11680
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-11680

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T15:11:21.695Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high) Zyxel Multiple Firewalls Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-11680 (9.8 critical) ProjectSend Improper Authentication Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-45727 (7.5 high) North Grid Proself Improper Restriction of XML External Entity (XEE) Reference Vulnerability

#CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked ðº "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-03T15:11:21.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high) Zyxel Multiple Firewalls Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-11680 (9.8 critical) ProjectSend Improper Authentication Vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-45727 (7.5 high) North Grid Proself Improper Restriction of XML External Entity (XEE) Reference Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-11220
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T18:30:56

2 posts

A local low-level user on the server machine with credentials to the running OAS services can create and execute a report with an rdlx file on the server system itself. Any code within the rdlx file of the report executes with SYSTEM privileges, resulting in privilege escalation.

CVE-2024-10516
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-12-06T14:15:19.667000

1 posts

The Swift Performance Lite plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Local PHP File Inclusion in all versions up to, and including, 2.3.7.1 via the 'ajaxify' function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to include and execute arbitrary files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files. This can be used to bypass access controls, obtain sensitive data, or achi

CVE-2024-49041
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-06T02:15:18.263000

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-12-06T13:27:11.234Z ##

Microsoft security advisory 05* December 2024:

  • CVE-2024-49041 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-12053 Type Confusion in V8 (originally announced by Google on 03 December 2024)

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. I guess this doubles as a release notes, that Microsoft Edge is now on version 131.0.2903.86: Edge Release Notes 05 December 2024 cc: @ruario

#microsoft #edge #chrome #chromium #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-06T13:27:11.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-49041 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-12053 Type Confusion in V8 (originally announced by Google on 03 December 2024)

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. I guess this doubles as a release notes, that Microsoft Edge is now on version 131.0.2903.86: Edge Release Notes 05 December 2024 cc: @ruario

(5.0 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T20:15:21.417000

2 posts

In OpenBSD 7.5 before errata 009 and OpenBSD 7.4 before errata 022, exclude any '/' in readdir name validation to avoid unexpected directory traversal on untrusted file systems.

##

CVE-2024-11667
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.18%

updated 2024-12-05T18:41:12.113000

9 posts

A directory traversal vulnerability in the web management interface of Zyxel ATP series firmware versions V5.00 through V5.38, USG FLEX series firmwareÂ versions V5.00 through V5.38,Â USG FLEX 50(W) series firmwareÂ versions V5.10 through V5.38, andÂ USG20(W)-VPN series firmwareÂ versions V5.10 through V5.38 could allow an attacker to download or upload files via a crafted URL.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked ðº "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
jbhall56 at 2024-12-04T14:03:42.715Z ##

The issue, tracked as CVE-2024-11667 (CVSS score of 7.5), is a high-severity flaw affecting the web management interface of Zyxel ATP, USG FLEX, and USG20(W)-VPN series devices. https://www.securityweek.com/cisa-warns-of-zyxel-firewall-vulnerability-exploited-in-attacks/

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-12-03T16:00:50.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked ðº "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T19:46:34.000Z ##

CCCS (Canada) security advisory: Zyxel security advisory (AV24-689)
The Canadian Centre for Cyber Security just outright said "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited."

While Zyxel's security advisory hasn't updated since 27 November 2024, and the language is ambiguous... This is an official government security advisory and CCCS could be referring to direct communication with the vendor. Patch your shit to address CVE-2024-11667 (7.5 high, disclosed 27 November 2024) Zyxel firewall directory traversal vulnerability. Threat actors are actively exploiting Zyxel firewalls to deploy Helldown ransomware.

#ransomware #helldown #zyxel #CVE_2024_11667 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #infosec #cybersecurity #cyberthreatintelligence #CTI

  • CVE-2024-38475 (7.5 high) Path traversal vulnerability â attributed to publicly known Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-40763 (7.5 high) SonicWALL SMA100 Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45318 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-53702 (5.3 medium) Insecure randomness ð¤ª
  • CVE-2024-53703 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild

CVE-2024-54127(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T15:31:09

2 posts

This vulnerability exists in the TP-Link Archer C50 due to presence of terminal access on a serial interface without proper access control. An attacker with physical access could exploit this by accessing the UART shell on the vulnerable device. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow the attacker to obtain Wi-Fi credentials of the targeted system.

This relates to CVE-2024-54126 and CVE-2024-54127.

##

CVE-2024-12094(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T15:31:02

4 posts

This vulnerability exists in the Tinxy mobile app due to storage of logged-in user information in plaintext on the device database. An attacker with physical access to the rooted device could exploit this vulnerability by accessing its database leading to unauthorized access of user information such as username, email address and mobile number.

1 repos

CVE-2024-53703
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T15:15:11.270000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the SonicWall SMA100 SSLVPN firmware 10.2.1.13-72sv and earlier versions mod_httprp library loaded by the Apache web server allows remote attackers to cause Stack-based buffer overflow and potentially lead to code execution.

jbhall56 at 2024-12-06T14:40:23.391Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-45318 and CVE-2024-53703, (CVSS score of 8.1), the two issues allow remote attackers to cause stack-based buffer overflows, which could potentially lead to code execution. https://www.securityweek.com/sonicwall-patches-6-vulnerabilities-in-secure-access-gateway/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-05T12:21:09.490Z ##

SonicWall security advisory 03 December 2024: SonicWall SMA100 SSL-VPN Affected By Multiple Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-38475 (7.5 high) Path traversal vulnerability â attributed to publicly known Apache HTTP Server vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-40763 (7.5 high) SonicWALL SMA100 Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45318 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45319 (6.3 medium) Certificate-based authentication bypass
  • CVE-2024-53702 (5.3 medium) Insecure randomness ð¤ª
  • CVE-2024-53703 (8.1 high) Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability

There is no evidence that these vulnerabilities are being exploited in the wild

#sonicwall #sma #sslvpn #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-42455
(7.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T11:15:04.533000

2 posts

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication allows a low-privileged user to connect to remoting services and exploit insecure deserialization by sending a serialized temporary file collection. This exploit allows the attacker to delete any file on the system with service account privileges. The vulnerability is caused by an insufficient blacklist during the deserialization process.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.270Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Vulnerabilities Resolved in Veeam Backup & Replication 12.3

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts
  • CVE-2024-42455 (7.1 high) authenticated arbitrary file deletion by sending a serialized temporary file collection
  • CVE-2024-42456 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42457 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (expose saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

No mention of exploitation but it's 2024 and Veeam still has NTLM hash vulnerabilities.

#veeam #vulnerability #cve #infosec #cybersecurity #PatchTuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts

##

CVE-2024-52564
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T10:31:40.663000

2 posts

Inclusion of undocumented features or chicken bits issue exists in UD-LT1 firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier and UD-LT1/EX firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier. A remote attacker may disable the firewall function of the affected products. As a result, an arbitrary OS command may be executed and/or configuration settings of the device may be altered.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T15:02:28.708Z ##

Unpatched and Exploited Zero-Days: Multiple vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers UD-LT1 and UD-LT1/EX
Two different sets of researchers reported vulnerabilities in I-O DATA routers to JPCERT/CC.

  • CVE-2024-45841 (6.5 medium) Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
  • CVE-2024-47133 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection
  • CVE-2024-52564 (7.5 high) Inclusion of Undocumented Features

The developer states that attacks exploiting these vulnerabilities have been observed.

The developer states that the updates addressing these vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-45841, CVE-2024-47133) are planned to be released around December 18, 2024. Too early to speculate and no additional information provided.

cc: @cR0w @mttaggart @ntkramer @dreadpir8robots @neurovagrant @goatyell @metacurity (remember to remove the mentions to avoid ReplyAll madness)

#vulnerability #jpcertcc #cve #IODATA #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

  • CVE-2024-47133 (7.2 high) OS Command Injection

CVE-2024-45841
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-05T10:31:40.227000

2 posts

Incorrect permission assignment for critical resource issue exists in UD-LT1 firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier and UD-LT1/EX firmware Ver.2.1.8 and earlier. If an attacker with the guest account of the affected products accesses a specific file, the information containing credentials may be obtained.

CVE-2024-20397
(5.2 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T17:15:11.913000

4 posts

A vulnerability in the bootloader of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated attacker with physical access to an affected device, or an authenticated, local attacker with administrative credentials, to bypass NX-OS image signature verification. This vulnerability is due to insecure bootloader settings. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by executing a series of bootloader

jbhall56 at 2024-12-05T13:50:47.254Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-20397, the high-impact security defect exists due to insecure bootloader settings that enable an attacker to execute specific commands to bypass the verification process and load unverified software. https://www.securityweek.com/bootloader-vulnerability-impacts-over-100-cisco-switches/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T16:05:37.320Z ##

Cisco security advisory 04 December 2024: Cisco NX-OS Software Image Verification Bypass Vulnerability
CVE-2024-20397 (5.2 medium severity but Cisco wrote high impact) A vulnerability in the bootloader of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated attacker with physical access to an affected device, or an authenticated, local attacker with administrative credentials, to bypass NX-OS image signature verification. No mention of exploitation/public disclosure.

#cisco #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_20397 #cisconxos #infosec #cybersecurity

Cisco security advisory 04 December 2024: Cisco NX-OS Software Image Verification Bypass Vulnerability
CVE-2024-20397 (5.2 medium severity but Cisco wrote high impact) A vulnerability in the bootloader of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated attacker with physical access to an affected device, or an authenticated, local attacker with administrative credentials, to bypass NX-OS image signature verification. No mention of exploitation/public disclosure.

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication allows users with certain operator roles to expose saved credentials by leveraging a combination of methods in a remote management interface. This can be achieved using a session object that allows for credential enumeration and exploitation, leading to the leak of plaintext credentials to a malicious host. The attack is facilitated by improper usage o

CVE-2024-42452
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T16:15:25.317000

2 posts

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication allows a low-privileged user to start an agent remotely in server mode and obtain credentials, effectively escalating privileges to system-level access. This allows the attacker to upload files to the server with elevated privileges. The vulnerability exists because remote calls bypass permission checks, leading to full system compromise.

CVE-2024-42453
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T15:15:11.390000

2 posts

A vulnerability Veeam Backup & Replication allows low-privileged users to control and modify configurations on connected virtual infrastructure hosts. This includes the ability to power off virtual machines, delete files in storage, and make configuration changes, potentially leading to Denial of Service (DoS) and data integrity issues. The vulnerability is caused by improper permission checks in

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T18:19:46.270Z ##

Veeam security advisory: Vulnerabilities Resolved in Veeam Backup & Replication 12.3

  • CVE-2024-40717 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42451 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (all saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-42452 (8.8 high) authenticated file upload privesc
  • CVE-2024-42453 (8.8 high) authenticated control/modify the configuration of connected virtual infrastructure hosts
  • CVE-2024-42455 (7.1 high) authenticated arbitrary file deletion by sending a serialized temporary file collection
  • CVE-2024-42456 (8.8 high) authenticated privesc
  • CVE-2024-42457 (7.7 high) authenticated information disclosure (expose saved credentials)
  • CVE-2024-45204 (7.7 high) authenticated NTLM hash leak of saved credentials

No mention of exploitation but it's 2024 and Veeam still has NTLM hash vulnerabilities.

CVE-2024-42451
(7.7 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T15:15:11.273000

2 posts

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication allows low-privileged users to leak all saved credentials in plaintext. This is achieved by calling a series of methods over an external protocol, ultimately retrieving the credentials using a malicious setup on the attacker's side. This exposes sensitive data, which could be used for further attacks, including unauthorized access to systems managed by

CVE-2024-40717
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-04T02:15:04.410000

2 posts

A vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication allows a low-privileged user with certain roles to perform remote code execution (RCE) by updating existing jobs. These jobs can be configured to run pre- and post-scripts, which can be located on a network share and are executed with elevated privileges by default. The user can update a job and schedule it to run almost immediately, allowing arbitrary

Google Chrome updated to version 131.0.6778.108/.109 for Windows, Mac and 131.0.6778.108 for Linux. It includes 4 security fixes, 1 externally reported: CVE-2024-12053 (high) Type Confusion in V8. No mention of exploitation.

Palo Alto Networks security advisory: PAN-SA-2024-0017 Chromium: Monthly Vulnerability Updates
Palo Alto Networks' Prisma Access Browser patched two older Google Chrome vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-11395 and CVE-2024-12053, which are both Type Confusion in V8 (JavaScript engine). "Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of these issues."

  • CVE-2024-49041 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability NEW!
  • CVE-2024-12053 Type Confusion in V8 (originally announced by Google on 03 December 2024)

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. I guess this doubles as a release notes, that Microsoft Edge is now on version 131.0.2903.86: Edge Release Notes 05 December 2024 cc: @ruario

CVE-2024-46905
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-12-03T20:00:17.570000

2 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2024.0.1, a SQL Injection vulnerability allows an authenticated lower-privileged user (at least Network Manager permissions required) to achieve privilege escalation to the admin account.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-03T19:14:21.854Z ##

Progress WhatsUp Gold security advisory: WhatsUp Gold Security Bulletinâ September 2024??
Progress completely ignoring the norms of vulnerability disclosure by silently patching a 24 September 2024 security advisory for WhatsUp Gold and only releasing the CVE IDs when threatened by Tenable (see the timeline).

  • CVE-2024-46908 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46909 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution
  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

See Tenable research advisory for the proof of concept. h/t Bleeping Computer: Exploit released for critical WhatsUp Gold RCE flaw, patch now

#progress #whatsupgold #wug #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_8785 #infosec #cybersecurity

  • CVE-2024-46907 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46906 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection
  • CVE-2024-46905 (8.8 high) authenticated privilege escalation via SQL injection

  • CVE-2024-8785 (9.8 critical) unauthenticated remote code execution via creating or changing an existing registry value

##

CVE-2023-28461
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 23.79%

updated 2024-12-02T17:15:05.133000

2 posts

Array Networks Array AG Series and vxAG (9.4.0.481 and earlier) allow remote code execution. An attacker can browse the filesystem on the SSL VPN gateway using a flags attribute in an HTTP header without authentication. The product could then be exploited through a vulnerable URL. The 2023-03-09 vendor advisory stated "a new Array AG release with the fix will be available soon."

screaminggoat at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.488Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked ðº "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-04T17:54:17.000Z ##

In case you were wondering why certain CVEs were added to CISA's KEV Catalog yesterday:

  • Zyxel Support Campus EMEA first noted threat actor activity targeting Zyxel firewalls on 09 October 2024. TrueSec noted that Helldown ransomware obtained initial access through Zyxel firewalls on 07 November 2024, positing that the threat actor either used the SSL-VPN service or exploited the firewall device. Sekoia assessed with high confidence that the attacker is exploiting a vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls on 19 November 2024, which Cyfirma agreed with on 26 November 2024. CERT-Bund (Germany) did not like the suggested CVEs, and suggested it was a zero-day on 22 November 2024. On 27 November 2024, Zyxel updated a security advisory to include a new CVE ID, CVE-2024-11667, which is a path traversal vulnerability. CCCS (Canada) explicitly wrote "Zyxel has reported that vulnerability CVE-2024-11667 has been exploited" on 02 December 2024.
  • VulnCheck posted on 26 November 2024 that that a patched "improper authentication" vulnerability in ProjectSend was never assigned a CVE back in May 2023, and that it was now being exploited in the wild. They quickly assigned an identifier: CVE-2024-11680 but due to the timing (Tuesday before a 4-day Thanksgiving weekend), CISA probably didn't add it until the following week.
  • Finally we have Proself CVE-2024-45727. Initially I had trouble finding remembering why it looked familiar until I dug through my post history: Trend Micro reported on 19 November 2024 that the threat actor "Earth Kasha" (overlaps with the Chinese state-sponsored APT10) exploited CVE-2024-45727 among other vulnerabilities.
    • Bonus exploitation evidence: Array Networks AG and vxAG ArrayOS Improper Authentication vulnerability CVE-2023-28461 was also mentioned in this same article, and was added to the KEV on 25 November 2024. However, CVE-2023-28461 was marked ðº "known to be used in ransomware campaigns" so CISA probably had a different source.

I want to provide context and exploitation evidence for all of the different vulnerabilities being added everyday.

#earthkasha #china #cyberespionage #rnaomware #helldown #CVE #CVE_2024_11667 #Zyxel #ProjectSend #CVE_2024_11680 #proself #CVE_2023_45727 #cisa #kev #cisakev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-44309
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-11-29T18:28:16.227000

3 posts

A cookie management issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in Safari 18.1.1, iOS 17.7.2 and iPadOS 17.7.2, macOS Sequoia 15.1.1, iOS 18.1.1 and iPadOS 18.1.1, visionOS 2.1.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to a cross site scripting attack. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited on Intel-based Mac systems.

1 repos

#search_error

ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:48:18.000Z ##

Also for anyone else who wants to check this on their distro of choice. It turns out that you do not need to inspect the package contents as I did. @sesivany kindly pointed out that the page about://version lists this information directly (even though the about dialog from "[main] Menu â About Web" does not).

Here is a screenshot from the current Flatpak version, confirming it is linked against WebKitGTK 2.46.4, which should be safe against the recent zero day issues that the Apple and the WebKitGTK security pages mention (i.e. CVE-2024-44308 and CVE-2024-44309).

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:25:45.000Z ##

The copy of Gnome Web provided by Ubuntu 24.04 is 46.0 and this is linked against libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.5, which is part of libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 version 2.46.3-0ubuntu0.24.04.1, a.k.a. WebKitGTK 2.46.3, which according to https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html is NOT protected against CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309

"Versions affected: WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

Put another way, don't use the deb version of Gnome Web that Ubuntu 24.04 provides (as I write this). It has known exploits in the wild. ð±

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-12-02T19:06:25.000Z ##

Understanding if Gnome Web (Epiphany) is up to date and secure is kind of a pain in the ass. The most up to date package available to me seems to be the Flathub package which is on version 47.2.

However, since the engine is WebKitGTK, its security page https://webkitgtk.org/security.html is just as (if not more) important. This page lists the most recent problems being annouced on November 27, 2024, specifically CVE-2024-44308, CVE-2024-44309. These are the same identifiers as the security issues that Apple announced on November 19, 2024 and those are zero day reports (known exploits in the wild), so I know they are serious shit https://support.apple.com/en-us/121752

But the WebKitGTK page does not say which versions of Gnome Web are affected. Rather it just says "WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit before 2.46.4."

https://webkitgtk.org/security/WSA-2024-0007.html

But what version of WebKitGTK is my flatpak packaged 47.2 linked against? ð¤·

In the end I started a shell into the flatpak package

```
flatpak run --command=bash org.gnome.Epiphany
```

and had a look around at the contents, eventually locating the file /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libwebkitgtk-6.0.so.4.10.6

Online seaching seems to suggest this file is associated with WebKitGTK version 2.46.4. So yeah, it should be patched against the zero day issues but that was a lot of work for me to be sure that it's secure.

##

CVE-2024-49806
(9.4 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-11-29T17:15:08.627000

1 posts

IBM Security Verify Access Appliance 10.0.0 through 10.0.8 contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key, which it uses for its own inbound authentication, outbound communication to external components, or encryption of internal data.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-02T19:20:13.000Z ##

IBM security advisory: Security Bulletin: Multiple Security Vulnerabilities were found in IBM Security Verify Access Appliance. (CVE-2024-49803, CVE-2024-49804, CVE-2024-49805, CVE-2024-49806)
"The IBM Security Verify Access appliance provides access and authentication management for user to web application sessions." (@cR0w this seems very similar to IdentityIQ's purpose innit?)

  • CVE-2024-49803 (9.8 critical) remote code execution vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49805 (9.4 critical) hardcoded credentials vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49806 (9.4 critical) hardcoded credentials vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-49804 (7.8 high) privilege escalation vulnerability

Leave it to a network security policy management solution to have hardcoded credentials. h/t: @xtrc

#IBM #vulnerability #CVE #infosec #cybersecurity

First announced 15 November 2024. Proofs of concept were available from watchTowr. Report is unconfirmed but source is a trusted partner. No indicators or additional information available.

Impact summary: Out of bound memory writes can lead to an application crash or even a possibility of a remote code execution, however, in all the protocols involving Elliptic Curve Cryptography that we're aware of, either only "n

kurtseifried at 2024-12-12T15:51:30.590Z ##

@bagder Hrmm, a quick look at OpenSSL this year:

CVE-2024-9143: Memory issue (out-of-bounds access) â Solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-6119: Memory issue (invalid memory access) â Solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-0727: Memory issue (NULL pointer dereference) â Solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-2511: Not a memory safety issue (unbounded growth) â Not directly solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-4741: Memory issue (use-after-free) â Solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-5535: Memory issue (buffer overread) â Solvable by Rust

##
screaminggoat at 2024-12-10T18:17:20.792Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Splunk:

  • SVD-2024-1201 Information Disclosure in Mobile Alert Responses in Splunk Secure Gateway (CVE-2024-53243, 4.3 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1202 Risky command safeguards bypass in "/en-US/app/search/report" endpoint through "s" parameter (CVE-2024-53244, 5.7 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1203 Information Disclosure due to Username Collision with a Role that has the same Name as the User (CVE-2024-53245, 3.1 low)
  • SVD-2024-1204 Sensitive Information Disclosure through SPL commands (CVE-2024-53246, 5.3 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1205 Remote Code Execution through Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Splunk Secure Gateway app (CVE-2024-53247, 8.8 high)
  • SVD-2024-1206 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - December 2024 (multiple CVEs)
  • SVD-2024-1207 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Universal Forwarder - December 2024 (CVE-2024-5535, 9.1 critical)

No verbiage of exploitation.

#splunk #infosec #cybersecurity #vulnerability #CVE

##
kurtseifried@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-12T15:51:30.000Z ##

@bagder Hrmm, a quick look at OpenSSL this year:

CVE-2024-9143: Memory issue (out-of-bounds access) â Solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-6119: Memory issue (invalid memory access) â Solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-0727: Memory issue (NULL pointer dereference) â Solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-2511: Not a memory safety issue (unbounded growth) â Not directly solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-4741: Memory issue (use-after-free) â Solvable by Rust
CVE-2024-5535: Memory issue (buffer overread) â Solvable by Rust

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-10T18:17:20.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Splunk:

  • SVD-2024-1201 Information Disclosure in Mobile Alert Responses in Splunk Secure Gateway (CVE-2024-53243, 4.3 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1202 Risky command safeguards bypass in "/en-US/app/search/report" endpoint through "s" parameter (CVE-2024-53244, 5.7 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1203 Information Disclosure due to Username Collision with a Role that has the same Name as the User (CVE-2024-53245, 3.1 low)
  • SVD-2024-1204 Sensitive Information Disclosure through SPL commands (CVE-2024-53246, 5.3 medium)
  • SVD-2024-1205 Remote Code Execution through Deserialization of Untrusted Data in Splunk Secure Gateway app (CVE-2024-53247, 8.8 high)
  • SVD-2024-1206 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Enterprise - December 2024 (multiple CVEs)
  • SVD-2024-1207 Third-Party Package Updates in Splunk Universal Forwarder - December 2024 (CVE-2024-5535, 9.1 critical)

No verbiage of exploitation.

#splunk #infosec #cybersecurity #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-23474
(7.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.27%

updated 2024-11-21T08:57:47.273000

2 posts

The SolarWinds Access Rights Manager was found to be susceptible to an Arbitrary File Deletion and Information Disclosure vulnerability.

screaminggoat at 2024-12-12T22:01:57.759Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: SolarWinds Access Rights Manager: One Vulnerability to LPE Them All
@chudypb writes about pre-auth arbitrary file deletion vulnerabilities in SolarWinds Access Right Manager (SolarWinds ARM) which interestingly lead to local privilege escalation on domain-joined Windows machines, even those on which SolarWinds ARM is not installed. SolarWinds has resolved these vulnerabilities related to ARM 2024.3. Piotr showcases CVE-2024-23474 SolarWinds ARM deleteTransferFile Directory Traversal (@cR0w) Arbitrary File Deletion and Information Disclosure Vulnerability and then describes scenarios to enumerate or find potential targets.

#solarwinds #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_23474 #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-12T22:01:57.000Z ##

@chudypb writes about pre-auth arbitrary file deletion vulnerabilities in SolarWinds Access Right Manager (SolarWinds ARM) which interestingly lead to local privilege escalation on domain-joined Windows machines, even those on which SolarWinds ARM is not installed. SolarWinds has resolved these vulnerabilities related to ARM 2024.3. Piotr showcases CVE-2024-23474 SolarWinds ARM deleteTransferFile Directory Traversal (@cR0w) Arbitrary File Deletion and Information Disclosure Vulnerability and then describes scenarios to enumerate or find potential targets.

CVE-2023-48788
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 71.08%

updated 2024-11-21T08:32:26.470000

2 posts

A improper neutralization of special elements used in an sql command ('sql injection') in Fortinet FortiClientEMS version 7.2.0 through 7.2.2, FortiClientEMS 7.0.1 through 7.0.10 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via specially crafted packets.

1 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2023-48788

malmoeb at 2024-12-06T20:28:52.515Z ##

Who actively monitors the Application Event Log for the Event ID 15457, containing the string xp_cmdshell?

The screenshot below is from an Incident Response engagement this year from an exploited FortiClient EMS server (CVE-2023-48788).

xp_cmdshell spawns a Windows command shell and passes in a string for execution but is disabled by default. For an attacker to abuse this feature, which is present in Microsoft SQL databases, it must be enabled first. Thus leaving a trace in the event log.

Searching through our datalake from all our customers, there is no single hit for the last month for this Event ID and the xp_cmdshell string. This might be a nice, almost zero FP alert. Sigma rule here:

https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/6fd57da13139643c6fe3e4a23276ca6ae9a6eec7/rules/windows/builtin/application/mssqlserver/win_mssql_xp_cmdshell_change.yml

##
malmoeb@infosec.exchange at 2024-12-06T20:28:52.000Z ##

Who actively monitors the Application Event Log for the Event ID 15457, containing the string xp_cmdshell?

The screenshot below is from an Incident Response engagement this year from an exploited FortiClient EMS server (CVE-2023-48788).

xp_cmdshell spawns a Windows command shell and passes in a string for execution but is disabled by default. For an attacker to abuse this feature, which is present in Microsoft SQL databases, it must be enabled first. Thus leaving a trace in the event log.

Searching through our datalake from all our customers, there is no single hit for the last month for this Event ID and the xp_cmdshell string. This might be a nice, almost zero FP alert. Sigma rule here:
